00019   def __init__(self, userModel):
00020     frameworkBase.FrameworkBase.__init__(self)
00021     self._d_model = userModel
00022     self._testRequirements()
00023     self._d_totalTimesteps = self._userModel().nrTimeSteps()
00024     self._d_trackCloned = {}
00025 
00026     # adding framework specific attributes and methods
00027     self._addAttributeToClass("_d_filterPeriod", 0)
00028     self._addAttributeToClass("_d_inFilterPeriod", False)

00030     self._addAttributeToClass("_d_inResume", False)
00031     self._addAttributeToClass("_d_inUpdateWeight", False)

00044     self.sizeStateVector = 0

00047   def setObservedMatrices(self, observations, covariance):
00048     assert type(observations) == numpy.ndarray
00049     assert type(covariance) == numpy.ndarray
00050     filtermoment = self._userModel().currentTimeStep()
00051 
00052     fileName = os.path.join("observedState",'obs%s.tmp' % (filtermoment))
00053     file = open(fileName, 'wb')
00054     pickle.dump(observations, file)
00055     file.close()
00056 
00057     fileName = os.path.join("observedState",'cov%s.tmp' % (filtermoment))
00058     file = open(fileName, 'wb')
00059     pickle.dump(covariance, file)
00060     file.close()

00077   def _testRequirements(self):
00078     #\todo test to dynamic framework model
00079     if not isinstance(self._d_model, mcFramework.MonteCarloFramework):
00080       self.showError("Model must be instance of MonteCarloFramework.")
00081       sys.exit()
00082 
00083     if not hasattr(self._d_model, 'run'):
00084       self.showError("No 'run' section defined.")
00085       sys.exit()
00086 
00087     if not hasattr(self._userModel(), 'setState'):
00088       self.showError("No 'setState' function defined.")
00089       sys.exit()
00090 
00091 
00092     if not hasattr(self._userModel(), 'resume'):
00093       msg = "Cannot run particle filter framework: Implement 'resume' method"
00094       raise frameworkBase.FrameworkError(msg)

00103   def _initialiseObservedDir(self):
00104     varName = "observedState"
00105 
00106     if not os.path.isdir(varName):
00107       # Create sample directory.
00108       os.mkdir(varName)
00109     else :
00110       #if not os.path.isdir(varName):
00111       #  # Remove existing file with name of sample directory.
00112       shutil.rmtree(varName)
00113       os.mkdir(varName)

00134   ## \brief Creates the subdirectories for state variables
00135   # \todo test if mc dirs are there...
00136   def _initialiseSampleDirectories(self):
00137     sample = self._userModel()._firstSampleNumber()
00138     while sample <= self._userModel()._lastSampleNumber():
00139       cwd = os.getcwd()
00140 
00141       dirname = "%d" % (sample)
00142       varName = "stateVar"
00143       os.chdir(dirname)
00144 
00145       if not os.path.isdir(varName):
00146         # Create sample directory.
00147         os.mkdir(varName)
00148       else :
00149         #if not os.path.isdir(varName):
00150         #  # Remove existing file with name of sample directory.
00151         os.remove(varName)
00152         os.mkdir(varName)
00153 
00154       os.chdir(cwd)
00155       assert os.path.exists(os.path.join(dirname,"stateVar")) and os.path.isdir(os.path.join(dirname,"stateVar"))
00156       sample += 1

00159   def setFilterTimesteps(self, filterTimesteps):
00160     assert type(filterTimesteps) == list or type(filterTimesteps) == numpy.ndarray
00161     #assert type(filterTimesteps) == list
00162     # \todo assert some more
00163     for filtertimestep in filterTimesteps:
00164       assert filtertimestep < self._userModel().nrTimeSteps()
00165     self._userModel()._d_filterTimesteps = filterTimesteps

00171   ## \brief Re-implemented from ShellScript.
00172   #
00173   # Runs the user model in the filter mode.
00174   def run(self):
00175     if(hasattr(self._userModel(), 'run')):
00176       self._userModel().run()
00177     else:
00178       self._atStartOfScript()
00179       self._initialiseStateDir()
00180       self._initialiseSampleDirectories()
00181 
00182       lastPeriod = len(self._userModel()._d_filterTimesteps)
00183 
00184       if lastPeriod == 0:
00185         self.showError("No filter timesteps specified")
00186         sys.exit()
00187 
00188 
00189 
00190       # set the proposal/initial weight distribution by user
00191       if hasattr(self._userModel(), 'setInitialParticleWeights'):
00192         self._userModel()._d_particleWeights = self._userModel().setInitialParticleWeights()
00193 
00194         # check initial weights
00195         assert type(self._particleWeights()) == list
00196         assert len(self._particleWeights()) == self._userModel().nrSamples()
00197 
00198         for i in range(0, len(self._particleWeights())):
00199           assert type(self._particleWeights()[i]) == float
00200 
00201       # run the premc loop
00202       self._userModel()._runPremcloop()
00203 
00204       # looping over the filter periods
00205       for currentPeriod in range(0, len(self._userModel()._d_filterTimesteps) + 1):
00206 
00207         # \todo replace with a better solution...
00208         sumW = sum(self._particleWeights())
00209         assert abs(sumW - 1.0) < 0.00001
00210 
00211         self._runMonteCarlo(currentPeriod, lastPeriod)
00212 
00213 
00214 
00215         if not currentPeriod == lastPeriod:
00216           # retrieve the state vectors for each sample
00217           for sample in range(1, self._userModel().nrSamples() + 1):
00218             self._userModel()._setCurrentSample(sample)
00219             self._userModel()._d_inUpdateWeight = True
00220             stateVector = self._userModel().setState()
00221             self._userModel()._d_inUpdateWeight = False
00222             assert type(stateVector) == numpy.ndarray
00223             fileName = os.path.join("stateVector",'ensMember%s.tmp' %(sample))
00224             file = open(fileName,'wb')
00225             pickle.dump(stateVector, file)
00226             file.close()
00227 
00228 
00229           # for current update moment
00230           self._getObservedValues()
00231           self._kalmanFilter()
00232 
00233 
00234           currentPeriod += 1
00235           self._userModel()._d_filterPeriod += 1
00236 
00237     self._userModel()._setFirstTimeStep(1)
00238     self._userModel()._runPostmcloop()
00239     return 0
00240 
00241   def _getObservedValues(self):
00242     self._userModel().setObservations()
00243 
00244   def _kalmanFilter(self):
00245     # following equations 44-52 from Geir Evensen's paper
00246     # 'The Ensemble Kalman Filter: theoretical formulation
00247     # and practical implemetation'
00248     #
00249     # n size of state vector (sizeStateVector)
00250     # m nr of observations (sizeObservedVector)
00251     # N nr of ensemble members
00252     #
00253     # A matrix with model states
00254     # H matrix 'measurement operator'
00255     # D matrix with observations
00256 
00257 
00258     fileName = os.path.join("stateVector",'ensMember%s.tmp' %(str(1)))
00259     file = open(fileName,'rb')
00260     vec = pickle.load(file)
00261     sizeStateVector = len(vec)
00262     file.close()
00263     # length of the observed vector \todo do we know that?
00264     fileName = os.path.join("observedState","obs%s.tmp" %(self._userModel()._d_filterTimesteps[self._userModel()._d_filterPeriod]))
00265     file = open(fileName,'rb')
00266     vec = pickle.load(file)
00267     sizeObservedVector = len(vec)
00268     file.close()
00269 
00270     nrEnsembleMembers =  self._userModel().nrSamples()
00271 
00272 
00273     # create A
00274     A = numpy.zeros((sizeStateVector, nrEnsembleMembers), dtype=float)
00275 
00276     # \todo is there a better way to construct a matrix from vecors?
00277     for sample in range(1, self._userModel().nrSamples() + 1):
00278       fileName = os.path.join("stateVector",'ensMember%s.tmp' %(sample))
00279       file = open(fileName,'rb')
00280       vec = pickle.load(file)
00281       file.close()
00282       for i in range(0, sizeStateVector):
00283         A[i,sample-1] = vec[i]
00284 
00285 
00286     # obtain H specified by user
00287     fileName = os.path.join("observedState","h%s.tmp" %(self._userModel()._d_filterTimesteps[self._userModel()._d_filterPeriod]))
00288     if os.path.exists(fileName):
00289       file = open(fileName,'rb')
00290       H = pickle.load(file)
00291       file.close()
00292     else:
00293       # or use the identiy matrix
00294       H = numpy.eye(sizeObservedVector, sizeStateVector, dtype=float)
00295 
00296 
00297     assert H.shape == (sizeObservedVector, sizeStateVector), "Shape of provided matrix H %s does not match (%s, %s)" %(H.shape, sizeObservedVector, sizeStateVector)
00298 
00299     # obtain D
00300     fileName = os.path.join("observedState","obs%s.tmp" %(self._userModel()._d_filterTimesteps[self._userModel()._d_filterPeriod]))
00301     file = open(fileName, 'rb')
00302     D = pickle.load(file)
00303     file.close()
00304 
00305     assert D.shape == (sizeObservedVector, nrEnsembleMembers), "Shape of provided matrix D %s does not match (%s, %s)" %(D.shape, sizeObservedVector, nrEnsembleMembers)
00306 
00307     # obtain error covariance matrix
00308     fileName = os.path.join("observedState","cov%s.tmp" %(self._userModel()._d_filterTimesteps[self._userModel()._d_filterPeriod]))
00309     file = open(fileName, 'rb')
00310     Re = pickle.load(file)
00311     file.close()
00312 
00313     assert Re.shape == (sizeObservedVector, sizeObservedVector), "Shape of provided matrix Re %s does not match (%s, %s)" %(Re.shape, sizeObservedVector, sizeObservedVector)
00314 
00315     # calculate Pe
00316     Abar = numpy.dot(A,numpy.array( [[1.0/nrEnsembleMembers] * nrEnsembleMembers ] * nrEnsembleMembers, dtype=float))
00317     Ad = A - Abar
00318     Pe =  1.0/(nrEnsembleMembers - 1) * numpy.dot(Ad,numpy.transpose(Ad))
00319 
00320     # calculate the new A matrix
00321     DmAH = D - numpy.dot(H,A)
00322 
00323     PeHt = numpy.dot(Pe,numpy.transpose(H))
00324 
00325     HPeHt = numpy.dot(H, PeHt)
00326     HPeHtpRe = HPeHt + Re
00327 
00328 
00329     INV = linalg.pinv(HPeHtpRe)
00330 
00331 
00332     INVDmAH = numpy.dot(INV, DmAH)
00333 
00334 
00335     A = A + numpy.dot(PeHt, INVDmAH)
00336 
00337 
00338     for sample in range(1, self._userModel().nrSamples() + 1):
00339       fileName = os.path.join("stateVector",'a%s.tmp' %(sample))
00340       file = open(fileName,'wb')
00341       index = sample - 1
00342       vec = A[:,index]
00343 
00344       pickle.dump(vec, file)
00345       file.close()
00346 
00347   ## \brief Returns the updated variables
00348   def getStateVector(self, sampleNumber):
00349     fileName = os.path.join("stateVector",'a%s.tmp' %(sampleNumber))
00350     file = open(fileName,'rb')
00351     vec = pickle.load(file)
00352     file.close()
00353     return vec

00357   def _normaliseWeights(self, weights):
00358     assert weights
00359     sumWeights = sum(weights)
00360     norm = [0.0] * len(weights)
00361     for i in range(0, len(weights)):
00362       norm[i] =  weights[i] / sumWeights
00363 
00364     return norm
00365 
00366 
00367   def _resetSampleWeights(self):
00368     assert self._userModel().nrSamples() > 0
00369     self._userModel()._d_particleWeights = [1.0 / self._userModel().nrSamples()] * self._userModel().nrSamples()
00370 
00371 
00372   def _cumulativeWeights(self, weights):
00373     cumulative = [0.0] * self._userModel().nrSamples()
00374     value = 0.0
00375     for i in range(len(weights)):
00376       value += weights[i]
00377       cumulative[i] = value
00378     return cumulative

00382   def _startEndOfPeriod(self, currentPeriod, lastPeriod):
00383     # determine start end end timestep of current period
00384     if currentPeriod == 0:
00385       startTimestep = 1
00386       endTimestep = self._userModel()._d_filterTimesteps[currentPeriod]
00387     elif currentPeriod == lastPeriod:
00388       startTimestep = self._userModel()._d_filterTimesteps[currentPeriod -1] + 1
00389       endTimestep = self._d_totalTimesteps
00390     else:
00391       startTimestep = self._userModel()._d_filterTimesteps[currentPeriod - 1] + 1
00392       endTimestep = self._userModel()._d_filterTimesteps[currentPeriod]
00393 
00394     assert startTimestep <= endTimestep
00395     return startTimestep, endTimestep
00396 
00397 
00398   def _executePrePostMc(self, currentPeriod, lastPeriod):
00399     if currentPeriod == 0:
00400       # execute premc
00401       premc = True
00402       postmc = False
00403     elif currentPeriod == lastPeriod:
00404       # execute postmc
00405       premc = False
00406       postmc = True
00407     else:
00408       # without pre/postmc
00409       premc = False
00410       postmc = False
00411     # \todo assert something
00412     return premc, postmc
00413 
00414   def _runMonteCarlo(self, currentPeriod, lastPeriod):
00415     #  get user model and (re)set start and end time
00416     startTimestep, endTimestep = self._startEndOfPeriod(currentPeriod, lastPeriod)
00417 
00418     self._userModel()._setNrTimeSteps(endTimestep)
00419     self._userModel()._setFirstTimeStep(startTimestep)
00420     self._userModel()._setCurrentTimeStep(endTimestep)
00421 
00422     # run the model in mc mode for current filter period
00423     self._incrementIndentLevel()
00424     self._atStartOfFilterPeriod(currentPeriod)
00425     self._d_model.run(False, False)
00426     self._atEndOfFilterPeriod()
00427     self._decrementIndentLevel()

00440   ## \brief reading deterministic data from disk
00441   # returns the map of the current time step from the current working directory
00442   def readDeterministic(self, name):
00443     if self._userModel()._inPremc() or self._userModel()._inPostmc() or self._userModel()._inInitial():
00444       newName = name + ".map"
00445     else:
00446       newName = generateNameT(name, self._userModel().currentTimeStep())
00447 
00448     import PCRaster
00449     return PCRaster.readmap(newName)
